newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks up 2.18 pct on foreign and local buy.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks up 2.18 pct on foreign and local buy.

text.p: Thai stocks extended gains on Thursday but late profit taking trimmed a sharp rally on hectic morning buying by foreign and local investors, traders said.
The SET Index rose 2.18 percent, or 15.96 points, to 747.70 on heavy 9.35 billion baht turnover. The SET 50 rose 2.77 percent, or 1.50 points, to 55.57.

"I would say there was healthy consolidation on yesterday's rally though foreigners took profits during the afternoon especially in the finance sector, retailers continued to buy the market," said a trader at Phatra Thanakit.
Turnover reached its high since mid-November as the baht's continued stability buoyed investors to follow through on Wednesday's 4.5 percent rally.
"It was very, very busy. The volumes were high so I think we might see more gains next week," he said.
"Even though foreigners were mostly taking profits in the afternoon, I think there will still be buying interest next week in selective stocks," he said.
Most active stocks saw gains trimmed by profit taking in the afternoon as the market came off its intraday high of 759.51.
Large commercial banks led the active list. Bangkok Bank rose four baht to 175, and Siam Commercial Bank gained six to 142.
Siam Cement put on 56 to 724, National Petrochemical extended its recent strong run, rising 2.25 to 26.50, and Phatra Thanakit (PHAT.BK added 4.5 baht to 55.50.
